duties_responsibilities.duty: Answers routine and specific inquiries, directs inquiries to the appropriate department, and assists in maintaining and monitoring the budget and grant allocations.
Initiates and follows through on human resources and payroll transactions, including weekly payroll submission.
Coordinates and resolves issues and problems with human resources and payroll, ensuring adequate restock of supplies for the department.
Plans and coordinates logistical arrangements for forums, conferences, seminars, meetings, and/or visiting professorships, including developing informational packets for participants.
Develops, updates, and/or revises informational flyers, brochures, and mailings, and researches, locates, and compiles information for reports.
Assists with the completion of grant applications, special projects, and survey preparations, as well as mentors, trains, and conducts orientation for new office support staff.
Coordinates administrative, secretarial, and/or general office support coverage, assigns work, sets deadlines, and supervises the work of assigned staff.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's Degree or equivalent combination of applicable5 years related administrative or business experience required. Some supervisory experience preferred. experience and education
